sen.j: 岩倉宮忠成王（いわくらのみやただなりおう、承久3年（1221年） - 弘安2年3月11日 (旧暦)（1279年4月23日））は鎌倉時代の皇族。
sen.e: Prince Iwakuranomiya Tadanari (1221-April 23rd, 1279) was a member of the Imperial family in the Kamakura period.

sen.e: Imperial Prince Sonkakuho, Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) and Imperial Prince Kakueho, Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple were his real brothers, and Emperor Chukyo and Imperial Prince Yoshimune were half brothers with the same father.

sen.j: 仁治3年（1242年）1月9日 (旧暦)四条天皇崩御の際、天皇は僅か12歳での崩御であった為皇太子が定まっておらず後継者選定に時間がかかった。
sen.e: As Emperor Shijo was only 12 years old when he died in 1242, the crown prince had not yet been selected, so it spent lots of time to select the successor.

sen.j: 王は皇嗣候補の1人として名が挙がり、一方の候補は土御門天皇皇子の後嵯峨天皇であった。
sen.e: Prince Tadanari was one candidate for the successor to the throne, and Emperor Gosaga, a prince of Emperor Tsuchimikado, was another.

sen.j: 忠成王には縁戚の九条道家がつき、邦仁王には土御門定通がつき夫々幕府に働き掛けた。
sen.e: Prince Tadanari supported by his relative, Michiie KUJO, and Prince Kunihito (Emperor Gosaga) supported by Sadamichi TSUCHIMIKADO made approaches to the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) separately.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府執権の北条泰時は順徳天皇の皇子である忠成王の即位に難色を示し、一時は軍事介入を仄めかしながら、鶴岡八幡宮の神意であるとして同じく後鳥羽天皇の孫にあたる邦仁王を推した。
sen.e: Disapproving of Prince Tadanari's enthronement because he was a prince of Emperor Juntoku, Yasutoki HOJO, the shogunal regent of the Kamakura bakufu, recommended Prince Kunihito, a grandchild of Emperor Gotoba, for the successor saying it was the god's will of Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine, hinting at a military intervention at one time.
